entities.name: winky
entities.description: Winky is a house-elf who is unhappy and being covered up by the other elves. She is mentioned as an example of how house-elves are treated poorly.

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is a student who is exasperated with Winky's situation and argues that house-elves have the right to be unhappy and should be treated fairly.

entities.name: dobby
entities.description: Dobby is a house-elf who is mentioned as an example of how house-elves can stand up for themselves and demand better treatment. He is used to support Hermione's argument that house-elves have the right to be unhappy.

entities.name: house-elves
entities.description: House-elves are a group of elves who are treated poorly and forced to work against their will. They are mentioned as being unhappy and deserving of better treatment.

relationships.description: Hermione defends Winky's right to be unhappy and argues that house-elves should be treated fairly. She says 'You've got just as much right as wizards to be unhappy!'
Hermione uses Dobby as an example of how house-elves can stand up for themselves and demand better treatment. She says 'look at Dobby!'
Winky represents the group of house-elves who are unhappy and deserving of better treatment. She is mentioned as an example of how house-elves are treated poorly.
